intro: Ligustrum suave, commonly known as sweet privet, is a species of flowering plant in the Oleaceae family. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, and it is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, simple, ovate leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are edible but not particularly flavorful. Ligustrum suave is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy flowers.
